channel.title: Simple question and need a simple answer
channel.description: I was looking at the tutorial on the tutorial page its the one on how to make a private server. I sall that this was made back in december of 09 and was just wondering if this is still working if i follow this? and if so what is the latest JDK?

item.title: Simple question and need a simple answer
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:8, topic:437606”][quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=540311.msg3956810#msg3956810 date=1332827614]
JDK1.7.0_03 is about as useful as anne-frank’s drum kit.
[/quote]
1.7.0_03 ≈ 1.6.0_30

Honestly nothing really changed, the ‘bugs’ that everyone complains about are commonly due to user error. It has very few flaws, but also very few improvements (if any).[/quote]

I think it’s a shit tonne more buggy, but that’s my opinion.

Read full topic
item.source: Simple question and need a simple answer

item.title: Simple question and need a simple answer
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Ruby Forums Coder:

JDK1.7.0_03 is about as useful as anne-frank’s drum kit.

1.7.0_03 ≈ 1.6.0_30

Honestly nothing really changed, the ‘bugs’ that everyone complains about are commonly due to user error. It has very few flaws, but also very few improvements (if any).

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question and need a simple answer
item.dc:creator: @twills twills
item.description:
@twills wrote:

OK thanks ill download the JDK1.6.0. Im look on the oracle website. this is my screen right now and im a little confused on which is the JDK1.6.0
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

Which JDK download is the JDK1.6.0?!
thanks for the help so far. and sorry im really clueless on this im just trying to learn.

Read full topic
item.source: Simple question and need a simple answer

item.title: Simple question and need a simple answer
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

If you follow that tutorial you will be able to get your server started. http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-7u3-download-1501626.html That’s the latest jdk version. I’d use a different version though because 1.7 isn’t that great

Read full topic
item.source: Simple question and need a simple answer

item.title: Simple question and need a simple answer
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

JDK1.7.0 is latest but I highly recommend JDK1.6.0_30, jdk1.7.0 has some flaws in it.

Read full topic
